text: the south korean military says it's
carried out a search operation after a
south korean man crossed the border into
north korea the circumstances of the
apparent defection are unclear but a
military source says the unnamed man
crossed from the demilitarized zone into
the north on saturday evening the office
of south korea's joint chiefs of staff
said it could not confirm whether the
person was still alive laura bicker in
seoul is following the story
there have been a number of breaches of
the border in the last few years but
this just to explain to your viewers is
one of the most heavily fortified areas
in the entire world it is a four
kilometer wide area full of landmines
surveillance equipment it is surrounded
by electric fences and normally there
are guards and watchtowers who are there
armed ready to react every 24 hours now
this happened in new year's day it has
happened in the same area in the last
year so there are being questions about
the security and surveillance of the
border area in this in the east coast
part of south korea now what appears to
happen is
an alert was raised about 6 40 on new
year's day and then a search was made
for about three or four hours they did
not find the individual and that
individual has then made it into north
korea now one of the things we do know
and certainly from one of my sources is
telling me that it is a civilian what we
don't know if it is if it's a south
korean citizen or whether or not it was
a north korean defector who was here in
the south who may have wanted to try to
go back north
laura bicker reporting
